article_text:
Malcolm Graham, a former N.C. state senator and Charlotte city councilman, is the brother of Cynthia Graham Hurd.

Hurd was one of 9 people killed in the Charleston church shooting

Graham: Sure, it’s a symbol. But our government needs to do much more to protect African Americans.

article_metadata.news-keywords: cynthia hurd, charleston nine, cynthia graham hurd, confederate flag, charleston shooting, malcolm graham
article_metadata.description: The world knows my sister Cynthia Graham Hurd, as one of the Charleston nine, murdered by a white supremacist in Emanuel AME Church this summer. But she is more than just a victim or a name scrolling across the bottom of a TV screen.
article_metadata.title: My sister was killed in the Charleston church shooting. Removing the Confederate flag isn’t nearly enough. | The Charlotte Observer

article_summary:
Malcolm Graham, a former N.C. state senator and Charlotte city councilman, is the brother of Cynthia Graham Hurd.
Hurd was one of 9 people killed in the Charleston church shootingGraham: Sure, it’s a symbol.
But our government needs to do much more to protect African Americans.
